page.title: 14OLD NUNNERY WARWICK BRIDGE
page.content: { HOLME EDEN ABBEY}was built in 1833 and was completed in 1840.Holme Eden Abbey has seven entrances for days in the week,three hundred and sixty five windows for days in the year, four grounds from basement to the third floor for weeks in the month.The first owner of Holme Eden Abbey was a man called Peter Dixon. He had 11 children altogether. A man called John Dobson designed and it.It is one of the few that J.Dobson designed outside Newcastle. When Peter Dixon died in 1920 a man called Mr.Liddle bought it. He gave it to the nuns 1921.80 nuns moved in and 8 nuns moved out in 1983. The building was bought by Mr Parsons who runs an old peoples home now. The impressive country house has ivy on the walls and stands on a bend in the river in its own grounds.
